alert.note: Alert for Kane; Washington (Utah) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued September 13 at 10:21AM MDT until September 13 at 11:15AM MDT by NWS Saltlake
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1115 AM MDT THIS MORNING FOR WEST CENTRAL KANE AND EAST CENTRAL WASHINGTON COUNTIES... At 1021 AM MDT, Doppler radar and park rangers indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Between 0.75 and 1.25 inches of rain has fallen. Flash flooding is already occurring in multiple areas within the park. The North Fork of the Virgin River has increased flows from near 50 cfs to over 1200 cfs. HAZARD...Life threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Radar and Park Rangers. IMPACT...Life threatening flash flooding of creeks, slot canyons and streams. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Zion National Park including the main canyon and area slot canyons. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Remain alert for flooding even in locations not receiving rain. Dry washes, streams, and rivers can become raging killer currents in a matter of minutes, even from distant rainfall. Flooding is occurring or is imminent. It is important to know where you are relative to streams, rivers, or creeks which can become killers in heavy rains. Campers and hikers should avoid streams or creeks.
